intro: Ceropegia galpinii, commonly known as the Galpin's arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and trailing stems. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate watering to prevent root rot. Ceropegia galpinii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
